intro: Hieracium bupleuroides subsp. dolense, commonly known as the Dolent's hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and produces yellow composite flowers that attract pollinators. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in mountainous regions. It is a perennial species with a relatively small range, primarily found in Central Europe. Its botanical features include narrow, linear leaves and a compact growth habit.
